definitions.definition: The result of launching a projectile or bullet.
definitions.example: The shot was wide off the mark.

definitions.definition: The act of launching a ball or similar object toward a goal.
definitions.example: They took the lead on a last-minute shot.

definitions.definition: The heavy iron ball used for the shot put.
definitions.example: The shot flew twenty metres, and nearly landed on the judge's foot.

definitions.definition: Small metal balls used as ammunition.
Metal balls (or similar) used as ammunition; not necessarily small.
(referring to one's skill at firing a gun) Someone who shoots (a gun) regularly
definitions.example: He'd make a bad soldier as he's a lousy shot.

definitions.definition: An opportunity or attempt.
definitions.example: I'd like just one more shot at winning this game.

definitions.definition: A remark or comment, especially one which is critical or insulting.
A punch or other physical blow.
A measure of alcohol, usually spirits, as taken either from a shot-glass or directly from the bottle, equivalent to about 44 milliliters; 1.5 ounces. ("pony shot"= 30 milliliters; 1 fluid ounce)
definitions.example: I'd like a shot of whisky in my coffee.

definitions.definition: A single serving of espresso.
A reckoning, a share of a tavern bill, etc.
A single snapshot or an unbroken sequence of photographic film exposures, or the digital equivalent; an unedited sequence of frames.
definitions.example: We got a good shot of the hummingbirds mating.

definitions.definition: A vaccination or injection.
definitions.example: I went to the doctor to get a shot for malaria.

definitions.definition: A home run that scores one, two, or three runs (a four run home run is usually referred to as a grand slam).
definitions.example: His solo shot in the seventh inning ended up winning the game.

definitions.definition: (US federal prison system) Written documentation of a behavior infraction.
(fisheries) A cast of one or more nets.
(fisheries) A place or spot for setting nets.
(fisheries) A single draft or catch of fish made.
To load (a gun) with shot.
A charge to be paid, a scot or shout.
